fullDescription.intro:
ART (art_Illumina Q version) is a simulation program to generate sequence read data of Illumina sequencers. ART generates reads according to the empirical read quality profile summarized from large real read data. ART has been using for testing or benchmarking a variety of methods or tools for next-generation sequencing data analysis, including read alignment, de novo assembly, detection of SNP, CNV, or other structure variation.
The current KNIME integration of art_Illumina can generate paired-end and mate-pair reads sequencing simulation of Illumina sequencing platform. The first-read insertion rate is set to default 0.00009, the second-read insertion rate to 0.00015 as well as the first-read deletion rate to 0.00011 and the second-read deletion rate to 0.00023. The outputs are two FASTQ read files (forward and reverse) out of diploid chromosomes of an individual (2 Fasta files). this integration is optimized for a trio (father, mother, child) which is created by Frost only. Hence it is strictly suggested to use this integration combined with Frost.
We suggest to use the Art node combined with Frost as previous node which would facilitate a parallelized run. The user can also start this node separately once Frost was already run.

ports.inPort:
Frost outputs
If optional port is available this tool will automatically continue
Otherwise the user has to specify the path of the directory with both haploid chromosomes of each individual (father, mother and child) in fasta format.
ports.outPort:
Trio fastqs
Cell 0: Fastq output for the forward read
Cell 1: Fastq output for the reverse read
Row 0: Read from father (chunkwise)
Row 1: Read from mother (chunkwise)
Row 2: Read from child (chunkwise)
